situation: P covered her ears and crouched under her desk when the class became particularly loud after a surprise birthday party broke out, causing sensory overload.
action: The teacher aide calmly approached P and offered her ear defenders, whispering comforting words. They moved to a quiet corner of the room to decompress with her favorite book until the noise subsided.
effect: P was able to rejoin the party once it quieted down and even socially interacted with peers, demonstrating controlled sensory responses.
topic: Sensory Overload Situations - scenarios involving overwhelming sensory inputs like loud noises, bright lights, or crowded spaces
